meanings.definition: To attribute or assign something to a different source or cause.
meanings.sent1: She decided to reattribute the success of the project to her team members.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reattribute the error to the correct department for accountability.
meanings.sent3: The detective's reattribution of the crime to the butler brought a surprising twist to the mystery.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Clue, players must reattribute the murder to a different suspect each time they play.
meanings.sent5: By reattributing the painting to a new artist, the art historian changed the entire narrative of art history.

meanings.definition: The act of giving credit or recognition to someone for their work or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The reattribution of the award to the correct recipient was a relief for everyone.
meanings.sent2: In academia, proper reattribution of sources is crucial to avoid plagiarism.
meanings.sent3: The reattribution of the invention to the young scientist made headlines in the scientific community.
meanings.sent4: Her reattribution of the success to her mentor showed her humility and gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The reattribution of the discovery to the overlooked researcher finally gave him the recognition he deserved.
